title: Account Executive
description: üéâ About the role  JOB TITLE: Account Executive  LOCATION: Based in the UK. This is primarily a remote role with monthly in-person team meetings in London which you will be required to attend and optional weekly co-working in London with the wider Empower team.   WORKING HOURS: Full-time 40 hours a week (core working hours 10am - 4pm). Flexi working hours and part-time applications (min. 4 days a week) considered.  SALARY: ¬£25000 ‚Äì ¬£29000 depending on experience  START DATE: ASAP üîó Link to full job description and further details hereüåç About EmpowerEmpower is a strategic digital partner for causes creating impact around the world.  Empowering people is our mission. It‚Äôs our vision for all causes to create positive social and environmental impact through effective digital communication.  To help organisations do this we develop insight-led digital strategies that enable their teams and move their supporters to act. We‚Äôre proud to be a B Corp and our commitment to mission-aligned work means we only work with people who share our values of being people-centred ethical and driven to create change. Check out some of our recent work here.Due to a run of recent client and project wins along with our long-standing campaigns for nonprofits and purpose-led clients we‚Äôre looking for an Account Executive to help run several of our key client accounts.üß© Diversity Equity and Inclusion at EmpowerDiversity equity and inclusion is a crucial part of our core values at Empower. Whilst we are proud of our diverse equitable and inclusive working environment we recognise we could do better and we are striving to improve our DEI efforts.We want diverse candidates because we recognise the strengths that our differences bring to the organisation the value in our different perspectives and the variety of lived experiences that enrich our team and our work.We welcome people from all backgrounds and walks of life and we are proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and Disability Confident Committed. We especially welcome applications from groups currently under-represented in our organisation including Black Asian minority ethnic groups LGBTQ+ and persons with disabilities and neurodiverse traits.All job applicants will receive equal treatment regardless of age disability gender identity sexual orientation race religion or belief education or socioeconomic background.We want you to have every opportunity to shine and show us your talents. Please let us know if there is anything we can do to make sure the process works for you.Further details about our recruitment process can be found here.üè°üíª Why we‚Äôre good to work for Do nice work for nice clients with a nice team (nice!) We want to work with the real you - see our Manuals of Me  We‚Äôre a dedicated B Corp!  Work with well-known brands in the purpose-led and nonprofit sector Flexible remote working in a friendly supportive working environment (you can work in your PJs if you want to as long as the work gets done!) Monthly meet-up in London with your colleagues for collaboration creativity and cake Modern working environment (our stack includes G-Suite Slack Asana) Internal team structure (you‚Äôll never work on an account alone and won‚Äôt have to worry about your handover when you‚Äôre taking a well-deserved break)  Hands-on experience and training in developing and implementing the latest digital marketing approaches ‚Äçüíª What you‚Äôll be doingOn every account you‚Äôll work with an Account Director and Account Manager and often digital specialists.  Organic Social & Content: Proudly own impeccable hands-on delivery of client channels community management and campaigns across channels such as LinkedIn X Facebook and Instagram. This includes ideas-driven content creation nuanced copy and thumb-stopping visuals.  Paid Media Email & Search: Work with your account team and Empower specialists to deliver paid email and search campaigns from devising strategy through to delivery and evaluation.  Insights & Reporting: Draw on your implementation work to deliver bespoke insight and analysis for your clients and work with your account teams to identify ideas and hypotheses for testing as well as proactive opportunities to educate your clients and enhance Empower‚Äôs work.  Client Servicing: Working with your account team to drive positive and productive client relations through daily interaction and delivery of Empower‚Äôs digital services. Develop skills to educate clients on best practice innovations and emergent trends and identify areas for account growth and improvement.  Task Management: Effectively manage and communicate progress around your daily / weekly tasks working with your account teams to ensure client work is delivered within agreed scopes and budgets.  Your account team will support you using project management tools such as Asana to plan next steps set timings and allocate tasks to other team members.   Innovation & Tools: Proactively stay across and have a genuine interest in understanding and applying industry tools digital trends and innovations. Package these up into weekly insights and ideas for Empower.  Digital Strategy: Deepen your understanding of digital strategy as you and your account team evolve and implement it for clients. Support colleagues in delivering knowledge transfer strategy development and transformation to clients via day-to-day servicing documents workshops and training.  Agency Development: Be an active participant of Empower‚Äôs digital and in-person meetings calls and projects - bringing ideas enthusiasm and a values-driven approach to our future. Please note: If you have video design paid email search and client experience that‚Äôs great - but don‚Äôt worry if you don‚Äôt have them we can train you up. Please don‚Äôt let this put you off applyingRequirements‚úÖ  Core competencies we look for:Empower seek these competencies across all levels. Although this is a junior role we‚Äôll be looking to see the potential to help you flourish in these areas:  Leadership: You inspire and influence others working proactively bringing forward solutions researching and sharing knowledge being future-oriented and fostering innovation.   Responsibility: You are punctual have optimal time deadline and task management. You are self-motivated consistent and communicate clearly and often as required by a mixture of autonomous and team remote work.  Relationships: You develop relationships with clients and colleagues that deliver on client-work agency and career development for yourself and others. You plan and use time well with others delivering the best possible outcomes and experiences.  Creativity: You apply inventive solutions to your work and apply flexible thinking bringing forward new ideas and evolving existing ways of working. You are hands-on and able to support varying tasks from social media to strategy and show willingness to learn along the way.  Commercial Awareness: You are hungry to understand what makes an organisation successful how your role may affect business performance and to deliver profitable client work and impactful internal projects.  Values-Driven: You are motivated to work for Empower as a B Corp and impact driven organisation. üîó Link to full job description and further details hereBenefitsüßòüèΩ‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è Our benefits package includes 25 days holiday plus UK bank holidays In addition Empower is closed between Christmas Day and New Years Day. Workplace pension scheme (5% Employer contribution) One day a week coworking with the London team or contribution to coworking space near your home. Full career development planning focused on career goals and role progression. ¬£1000 equipment budget with additional support for needs uncovered by workplace assessment. Annual wellness subscription of your choice eg: Headspace Oddbox etc Access to on-demand mental health support and tools provided by Spill. Free annual exam and glasses contribution if screen use impacts prescription Family support: Progressive package inclusive of mental health miscarriage conception menopause bereavement support. Shared Parental offerings include 12 weeks leave on 90% of normal pay. Annual charitable donation: ¬£200 per person donation of your choice plus a coordinated team fund of ¬£1000. One day per year to volunteer at a place of your choosing. Our recruitment processInviting someone to join our team is a big deal for us and we put a lot of time and effort into the process. We don‚Äôt want to waste anyone‚Äôs time so if we figure out we‚Äôre not perfect for each other at any stage we‚Äôll let you know. Apply for the job through one of the links below. You‚Äôll have a half hour chat over GoogleMeet with a few of our team members so we can find out more about your experience and ambitions. If we think you‚Äôre a good match for the role we‚Äôll book you in for a face-to-face interview via GoogleMeet. To keep things fair and for you to show your best we will provide you with a list of questions we‚Äôll be asking during the interview. For some roles there are also a few short tasks to complete which we will provide details of well in advance of the interview to give you plenty of time to prepare. This will also be a chance to meet some of the people you‚Äôd be working with and ask any questions about working at Empower. That‚Äôs it! If everyone‚Äôs happy we‚Äôll make you an offer. Guidance on how to make an application and our recruitment process can be found here.PLEASE NOTE: This position is open to candidates based in the UK only. Please only apply if you are resident in the UK and have existing right to work in the UK.The deadline for applications is Wednesday 17th January 2024 11:59pm GMT.Our initial half hour telephone chats will take place on 23rd and 25th January 2024.Shortlisted candidates will then be invited to a face-to-face virtual interview taking place via Google Meet on either Monday 29th January or Thursday 1st February 2024.Please keep these dates free and be aware that there will be a short notice period before each interview. If you have any questions about the role please email Catherine Raboteur HR & Operations Manager at catherine@empower.agency

title: Account Executive - Outbound
description:
Outbound Account Executive - Health-Tech SaaS (CANADA)
Company: ShiftCare
Location: Canada (Remote)
Salary: CAD $80 000 Base $105 000 OTE 
¬†
About ShiftCare:
ShiftCare a leading Australian health-tech SaaS provider is on a mission to revolutionize home healthcare solutions. Headquartered in Sydney with a solid and continually growing footprint in the APAC region we are now expanding in North America.
Join us in shaping the future of health-tech and making a meaningful impact on the lives of others.
Position Overview:
As the Outbound Account Executive for the Canadian territory you will be at the forefront of our North American expansion. Youll play a pivotal role in qualifying and presenting the ShiftCare value proposition to potential customers identified through outbound activities. We are seeking dynamic individuals who thrive on challenges and are passionate about making a difference.
Responsibilities:

Develop and implement outbound sales strategies for lead generation and new business growth.
Identify and prospect potential customers through email phone and social media channels.
Utilize a consultative sales approach to understand customer needs and present the value proposition of our solutions.
Collaborate with marketing to optimize messaging and campaign strategies.
Work with the sales team to develop and execute proposals and presentations.
Meet and exceed monthly and quarterly sales targets.
Provide regular reports on sales performance and market insights.

Requirements

Bachelors degree in Business Marketing or a related field.
2+ years of outbound business development or sales experience in SaaS.
Experience in the home healthcare industry is highly desirable.
Proven success in generating leads and closing deals in a SaaS environment.
Experience in AMS HR HCM Workforce Management and Payroll domains would be advantageous.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
Strong organizational and time management skills.
Results-oriented mindset with a track record of meeting and exceeding sales targets.
Proficiency in HubSpot.

Benefits
Why Join ShiftCare?
We offer a competitive salary and commission structure along with a dynamic and collaborative work environment. You will work closely with and receive mentorship from a local senior member of the sales team whilst reporting into our Global Sales Manager who is based in Australia.
¬†

Fast-track Growth:

Experience quick career advancement in our growth-oriented environment ensuring your potential is recognised and rewarded.

Job Security:

Rest easy with stable ownership and meticulous team growth management building your career on a foundation of stability and forward-thinking.

Professional Development Opportunities:

Access various training programs online courses workshops and coaching sessions for continuous professional and personal growth.

Floating Public Holidays:

Enjoy flexibility to celebrate preferred holidays or personal events with floating public holidays.

Remote Work:

Embrace a work-life balance with remote work options supported by necessary technology and tools for efficient and effective performance.


At Shiftcare we prioritise creating a workplace where employees can thrive both professionally and personally.
If you are a driven and experienced Outbound Account Executive with a passion for health-tech and want an opportunity to be immersed in career defining work we encourage you to apply

title: Enterprise Account Executive
description: As an Enterprise Account Executive you‚Äôll be an expert in selling ActivTrak and play a key role in building our Enterprise motion.¬† In this role you will: Drive and own the end-to-end sales cycle from identifying targeted Enterprise accounts to closing business opportunities across the assigned territory. Prospect and identify leads leveraging personal networks and partnering closely with Marketing and SDRs. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. ActivTrak does not discriminate on the basis of race color religion sex national origin political affiliation sexual orientation marital status disability age protected veteran status gender identity or any other factor protected by applicable federal state or local laws. #LI-REMOTE

title: Web Designer UI/UX Masters Level Intern
description:
Web Designer UI/UX University Masters Level Intern
Company Overview:
At Vosyn we embrace the exciting game-changing world of Artificial Intelligence driving innovation and pioneering impactful projects across various industries. We believe in fostering a culture of flexibility continuous improvement and solution-focused strategies. Here every idea is welcomed nurtured and has the potential to scale to new heights. Currently were at the forefront of a significant IPO endeavour truly a unicorn in the making. We invite you to be part of our journey and leave your imprint on the future of AI.
¬†
About the Job:
Were on the lookout for an Intern specialising in Web Designer UI/UX to play a crucial role in an exciting AI project. If you harbour a strong passion for Digital Futures and are skilled in creating exceptional user interfaces we want to connect with you. As a UI/UX Design Intern youll have the chance to work closely with our technology contributing directly to the design and enhancement of our platform interfaces. Your contributions will directly affect the trajectory of this cutting-edge technology.
What Youll Do:

Contribute to the design and development of our product user interfaces¬†
Collaborate with our software and AI teams to create intuitive user-centric designs¬†
Participate in user testing and feedback sessions to refine our designs¬†
Assist in the analysis and incorporation of user behaviour data into our UI/UX design¬†
Support troubleshooting and resolution of issues during the design and testing phases¬†
Contribute to the documentation of design processes and findings.

About You:

Currently pursuing a Bachelor of Fine Arts or a Bachelor of Design degree¬†
Strong design skills with a portfolio showcasing your talent for UI/UX¬†
Deep understanding of design principles and a keen eye for aesthetics¬†
Excellent problem-solving abilities¬†
Strong written and verbal communication skills¬†
Passion for innovation and pushing the boundaries in design¬†
Previous experience in web design is a plus but not required.

Additional Perks:

Experience the exhilarating journey of a start-up transitioning to an IPO.¬†
Engage directly with senior management and strategic advisory board members.¬†
Boost your CV with a diverse set of experiences unique to AI Venture Lab.¬†
Get priority consideration for full-time roles post-internship.

Duration and Compensation:
This is a full-time & part-time paid internship with the following placement options:¬†
1) Fall
2) Winter
3) Spring
4) Summer
Flexibility with timing and location should not deter you from applying. The compensation will be $32-35 CAD per hour commensurate with experience and qualifications.¬†
We are an equal-opportunity employer committed to fostering a safe diverse inclusive environment.

title: Brand Design Associate
description: Our MissionAt Big Health our mission is to help millions back to good mental health by providing fully digital non-drug options for the most common mental health conditions. Our digital therapeutics ‚Äî Sleepio for insomnia Daylight for anxiety and SparkRx for depression ‚Äî provide treatment anytime anywhere.¬†In pursuit of our mission we‚Äôve pioneered the first at-scale digital therapeutic business model in partnership with some of the most prominent global healthcare organizations including CVS Health and the UK‚Äôs NHS. Through product innovation robust clinical evaluation and a commitment to equity at scale we are designing the next generation of medicine and the future of mental health care.¬†Our VisionOver the next 5-10 years digital therapeutics (DTx) will transform the delivery of health care worldwide providing access to safe and effective evidence-based treatments to billions. Big Health is in a prime position to take the lead in this transformation.Big Health is a remote-first company and this role can be based anywhere in the US. We encourage you to apply even if you don‚Äôt meet 100% of the job requirements.Join UsAs a member of the Commercial team you‚Äôll report to the Director of Product Marketing and work closely with the marketing and sales teams. The Associate Brand Designer will bring our offerings to life with the goal of accelerating a pipeline of opportunities while enhancing the Big Health brand.Job Responsibilities:Graphic Design: Create visually stunning and effective designs for various marketing materials including but not limited to print collateral digital assets social media graphics and promotional items.Brand Identity: In partnership with Marketing leadership support the creation and maintenance of a cohesive and compelling brand identity that reflects our company values and resonates with our target audience.¬†Collaboration: Work collaboratively with marketing product and other cross-functional teams to ensure brand consistency across all touchpoints.Conceptualization: Generate innovative ideas and concepts for brand campaigns product launches and other marketing initiatives.Market Research: Stay informed about industry trends competitors and design innovations to ensure our brand remains fresh and relevant.Feedback and Iteration: Gather feedback from stakeholders and iterate on designs to refine and enhance visual communication.Required Skills and Experience:A minimum of 2 years prior experience as a Brand Designer with a strong portfolio showcasing a range of design projectsProficiency in industry-standard design software (e.g. Adobe Creative Suite Figma).Excellent understanding of design principles design thinking and ideation typography color theory and layout. Experience with story boarding and motion design is a plus.¬†Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced environment.Experience working with cross-functional teams and managing multiple projects simultaneously.Strong communication skills and the ability to present and articulate design concepts.Life at Big Health:Be part of a team that includes clinical psychologists software engineers business leaders and even a former professional magician shh‚Ä¶ it‚Äôs a secret.Surround yourself with the smartest most enthusiastic and dedicated people you‚Äôll ever meet but who listen well learn from their mistakes and when things go wrong generously pull together to help each other out.Check out our values - they‚Äôre a living breathing part of our culture.Enjoy benefits including a generous vacation policy professional development fund flexible working locations and more.Competitive salary packages including stock optionsBecause we are on a mission to bring millions back to good mental health we believe it‚Äôs essential to reflect the diversity of those we intend to serve. We‚Äôre an equal opportunity employer dedicated to building a culturally and experientially diverse team that leads with empathy and respect. Additionally we will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance. Big Health participates in E-Verify and will provide the federal government with Form I-9 information from all new employees to confirm that they are authorized to work in the U.S. Big Health does not use E-Verify to pre-screen applicants.

title: API Technical Writer
description:
A software development company is looking for a talented and detail-oriented API Technical Writer to join their growing team. The company creating the world‚Äôs most used route sequencing and optimization software for small businesses and enterprises. With over 35000 customers the company helps last mile businesses save tremendous amounts of money time and labor. Moreover provides seamless continuity through the entire route planning route dispatch route navigation and tracking process.‚ÄØ  The company offers exposure to a variety of industries and technologies room to grow as a professional time in projects to learn new skills and an opportunity to work with phenomenal coworkers some of the best people on the planet. As an API Technical Writer you will play a crucial role in creating clear concise and comprehensive Technical Documentation. Your documentation will be essential in assisting developers partners and customers in effectively understanding integrating and utilizing API. The first and most important project is to analyze and improve our existing API documentation. After that there will be opportunities to continue our collaboration as a Technical Writer on other projects. As an API Technical Writer you will: 
Create and maintain high-quality API documentation including reference guides developer guides tutorials sample code examples and similar documentation.
Improve existing API documentation and ensure that it adheres to the companys style guidelines is user-friendly and follows industry best practices (examples will be provided).
Collaborate with development teams to gather technical information and specifications needed for accurate API documentation.
Keep the API documentation up-to-date with the latest API releases changes and improvements.
Contribute to API release notes communicating changes enhancements and bug fixes to developers and stakeholders.
Requirements: 
Proven experience of 5+ years as a Technical Writer with a focus on API documentation.  
Proven experience using such tools as Jira Confluence Swagger OpenAPI Postman ReadMe Lucidchart Google Workspace tools and similar.  
Strong understanding of APIs RESTful web services and programming concepts with respective proven experience.  
Experience creating training manuals instructional materials video tutorials and other types of learning content.  
Proficiency in writing clear concise and well-structured technical documentation.  
Attention to detail and a commitment to delivering accurate and user-friendly documentation.  
Excellent communication and collaboration skills with the ability to work effectively with cross-functional teams.
Nice to have: 
Experience with markup languages (e.i. Markdown) version control systems (e.i. Git) and documentation formatting tools.  
Experience in software development or exposure to coding languages (e.i. Python PHP etc.).
Benefits: 
Semi-flexible working hours; 
Completely remote work; 
Interesting projects to work on; 
Exposure to a variety of industries and technologies; 
Paid vacations and sick leaves.  
#Li - remote

title: Product Marketing Manager
description: DescriptionJOB RESPONSIBILITY/SUMMARYThe primary responsibility of the Product Marketing Manager is a hybrid roll and will be involved in both internal and external marketing with a focus on product Marketing technical marketing competitive and solutions marketing. Closely allied with the Product Management (PM) function the PMM creates messaging and positioning that create demand for the products that the PM team manages. Key constituents for the PMM team are Customers Partners Resellers Prospects Sales Content Marketing and other corporate marketing functions (such as website digital campaign and channel marketing etc.). The PMM works very closely with the Senior Director of Product Marketing to help develop the ‚Äúgo-to-market‚Äù strategy on the tactical level with a strong focus on products/solutions/technology and competitive insights resulting in BOLD product positioning. The PMM is responsible for executing Product Launch Planning (PLP) with the broader marketing team assuring that consistent and updated positioning and messaging is fully utilized and understood. The Product Marketing Manager helps define and drive needs for tools programs and training to show the field customers analysts the press and the public the value and need for Infinidat solutions in their business.Responsibilities: ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONSDevelop manage and drive the creation of a comprehensive set of tools and programs for Infinidat products such as: Sales Aids (not an exhaustive list we need to add more as needed):-Marketing Data & Technical Spec Sheet-Competitive Analysis-Statements of Product Positioning-Product Messaging-Features/Benefits-Other sales and training aids-Success Stories/Case Studies ‚Äì working with Content management-Product Guide-Tutorial /Reviewers Guide¬†-Web Site-Direct Mail-Compatibility Matrix-Product Demos-Tradeshow support-And other tools as necessaryWorks closely with Infinidat‚Äôs field teams to gather market and competitive data to feed to the PM team.Working with the sales enablement and product management teams for all sales and channel partner training.¬†Works with Marcom/Content to produce sales tools trade shows programs web content and other demand-creation vehicles.Works with the product management sales and channel partner teams to drive the sales of new solutions.Maintain and Edit technical competitive analysis to support sales and tool creation.Strong presentation capabilities to be able to present at industry events/trade shows to end users (existing customers and prospects) and to channel partners/distributors.Extremely well-technically versed in the product and its competitive benefits and advantages to be able to evangelize outside Infinidat.ÔªøRequirementsMinimum Education: Bachelor‚Äôs degree in related field preferably technical or equivalent.Minimum Experience: 7+ years of product marketing technical marketing systems engineering/solutions architecture or product engineering for primary and secondary storage companies MANDATORY.Knowledge: In-depth understanding of product marketing technical marketing and solutions marketing. Excellent knowledge of the competitive landscape for storage subsystems secondary and primary storage software defined storage and modern data protection and cyber resilient storage systems and software. Broad technical and market knowledge of subsystems storage products and storage technologies - to include memory technologies external storage systems SAN NAS Flash backup disaster recovery and business continuity cyber resilient storage technology and disk and host interfaces.¬†¬†Analytical/Interpersonal Skills: Strong business and technical skills. Excellent interpersonal skills working with sales marketing engineering and business management. Required to enthuse and excite potential customers and sales regarding product concepts execution solutions and markets. Excellent presentation skills. Required to analyze competitive technology and products and make recommendations to product management on technical features for coming products. Experience managing teams directly as well as from a matrix perspective.

title: Full Stack Engineer (Web)
description:
¬†
Codifi | Full Stack Engineer (Web) | Remote
¬†
Company Profile‚ÄØ¬†
Codifi is building the ultimate digital solution for fieldwork that primes users in unique industries (cultural resource/heritage management tribal archaeology paleontology and more) to approach field data-gathering with respect and reverence increasing the quality of data capture and preservation with user-friendly intelligent and intuitive digital tools and liberating humans from the drudgery of forms.
¬†
This role requires a creative and capable designer and strategic thinker who thrives in a collaborative fast-paced agile working environment with a balanced mix of excellence and urgency.
¬†
Hire Type:¬†Full-time (salaried) ¬†¬†
Schedule:¬†40 hours Monday‚ÄìFriday (flexible schedule)¬†
Location:¬†Remote: work from home
¬†
Job Description
As a Full Stack Engineer for our Web application your role is pivotal in designing and implementing practical solutions connecting front-end systems with back-end services to deliver innovative Enterprise SaaS experiences.
¬†
In this role you will lead the development of our Single Page Web application Microservices and Orchestration APIs. You should possess a proven track record of creating innovative and scalable solutions using React .Net Core 7 C# NodeJS Typescript MongoDB and MySql.
¬†
Your responsibilities include hands-on design and development leadership management and collaboration with a hybrid on-shore/augmented team to create pragmatic solutions to complex business requirements within the context of digital transformation initiatives.
¬†
Responsibilities

Work closely with product owners business analysts and solution architect to understand the business and platform needs and deliver innovative solutions to complex problems
Collaborate with internal and external partners to define technical user stories build and test solutions
Work with Frontend and Backend applications and cross-functional teams to design integrated solutions test and deploy
Design and build Web applications with enhanced UX
Build and maintain APIs for internal and external exposure
Implement unit and automated integration tests
Think critically and provide end-to-end solutions that can impact multiple systems
Design deploy and manage cloud serverless architecture in Azure and AWS
Represent the Digital team in various other areas of IT to provide integrated solutions
Work on products built in Agile and DevOps delivery models
Establish and adhere to coding standards and follow GitLab/VSTS branching and release strategies best practices
Create solution architectures and application designs that are flexible and scalable
Contribute to engineering communities of practice and document work

¬†
Support Received
Expected to perform with independence and initiative with direct support from the Head of Engineering. Expected to collaborate with other company leaders and members of the Product and Technical Teams including Analysts Developers and Quality Assurance.
¬†
Required Qualifications

BS or MS degree in Computer Information Science or related technical field
5+ years of experience developing Web Applications/SPA utilizing React.js & Typescript (and/or other JS frameworks)
5+ years of software engineering experience in building APIs and supporting backend services with .NET Core NoSQL DB and relational DB
5+ years of software engineering experience in building frontend applications with React
Expert in .Net Core and C#
Expert in unit and automated integration testing on both APIs and frontend applications
Expert in React reusable React components React hooks and integrating with APIs
Expert with Production hand-off and support
Experience working in a fast-paced start-up/MVP-focused environment
Experience with Agile development methodologies

Preferred Skills

Excellent analytical problem-solving and troubleshooting skills.
Excellent team player with proven ability to influence diverse stakeholder groups
Willing to learn and work in a highly adaptable continuously changing environment.
Able to give and receive open honest feedback and to foster a highly collaborative environment
Outstanding communication interpersonal and relationship building skills for team development

¬†
Additional Information‚ÄØ¬†
Chronicle Heritage and Codifi offers great benefits package and huge growth potential. Pay will be commensurate with experience and bonuses may be offered for exceptional performance. Our benefits package includes health dental and vision insurance a 401(k) plan with employer matching paid time off (PTO) telecommuting and mentorship programs for career growth. ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ
Chronicle Heritage and Codifi participates in E-Verify to ensure all staff are authorized to work in the United States. Chronicle Heritage is also an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer that provides equal employment opportunities to all applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race color religion age sex national origin disability status genetics protected veteran status sexual orientation gender identity or expression or any other characteristic protected by federal state or local laws.‚ÄØ‚ÄØ‚ÄØ
¬†
We encourage underrepresented groups women and members of the LGBTQIA+ community to apply.¬†
¬†
¬†

title: Technical Recruiter Contractor
description:
Position SummaryThis is a 1099 contractor position with part-time to full-time hours. The Technical Recruiter assists with the full-cycle recruiting process for entry level to senior level roles. They assist with sourcing screening and selecting qualified candidates for technical positions within the organization.  They work closely with the HR Manager hiring managers and other stakeholders to understand the company‚Äôs staffing needs and ensure a smooth recruitment process.  LocationLas Vegas San Francisco Seattle NYC or RemoteKey ResponsibilitiesCandidate Sourcing:Use various sourcing methods such as online job boards social media networking and employee referrals to identify potential candidates.Build and maintain a network of industry contacts to tap into for talent acquisition.Candidate Screening and Evaluation:Review resumes and applications to identify candidates who meet the technical and cultural requirements.Conduct initial phone screenings to assess candidates qualifications and interest in the position.Coordinate technical assessments and interviews with relevant teams or managers.Interview Coordination:Schedule and coordinate interviews between candidates and hiring managers or technical teams.Provide candidates with all necessary information about the interview process and company.Candidate Assessment:Evaluate candidates technical skills qualifications and cultural fit.Gather feedback from interviewers and hiring managers to make informed hiring decisions.Offer Management:Extend job offers to selected candidates and negotiate terms and conditions.Ensure a smooth transition for candidates who accept job offers.Documentation and Compliance:Maintain accurate and up-to-date records of all recruitment activities.Ensure compliance with all relevant employment laws and regulations.Talent Pipeline Management:Develop and maintain a talent pool of potential candidates for future openings.Implement strategies for proactive recruitment.Reporting and Analytics:Generate and analyze recruitment metrics and reports to assess the effectiveness of recruitment efforts.Make data-driven recommendations for process improvements.Requirements:Education and Experience:
Bachelors degree in Human Resources Business Administration or a related field (or equivalent experience).
Proven experience as a Technical Recruiter or in a similar role preferably in a technology-focused environment.
Skills: 
Strong understanding of technical roles skills and industry trends.
Familiarity with applicant tracking systems (ATS) and recruitment software.  Familiarity with Ashby ATS preferred. 
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
Strong organizational and time-management abilities.
Ability to work independently and collaborate effectively with hiring managers and teams.
Knowledge of relevant employment laws and regulations.
More on Sleeper
Headquartered in Las Vegas NV Sleeper is backed by Silicon Valley‚Äôs top investors including Andreessen Horowitz General Catalyst and Expa.To learn more visit us online at:www.sleeper.comOriginally posted on Himalayas

title: Director, Technical Services
description:
The Director of Technical Services exists to lead and scale a team of talented support professionals and implementation managers supporting all customers of 15Five. This role is critical to driving adoption of the 15Five platform by providing key technical support for the more than 3500 customers. Establishing clear performance measurements and alignment to Customer Health are key aspects of this role. Success is dependent on a strong relationship with Product and Engineering teams as well as the entire Customer Experience (CX) organization.OUTCOMES
Build and operate a highly effective support organization goaled on helping customers achieve their Outcomes
You develop key capabilities on the team to build and execute an exceptional level of support for our customers and raise their level of Customer Maturity by removing obstacles.
You have clear performance metrics that are shared with the entire company on how the team is exceeding customer expectations.
You have greatly improved the working relationship with product and development teams to provide critical feedback on customer requests
You develop key customer relationships and create cross functional relationships with 15Five to support customer outcomes in those accounts and/or customer segments
You provide key insight as to key moments of truth for customers at various stages of their journey
You act quickly and decisively to resolve customer escalations and provide space for root-cause analysis
Scale and operate a team of Implementation Managers geared towards time to value for customer Outcomes and accelerating a customer outcome journey
You manage key operational metrics that describe performance customer experience and team capacity
You create repeatable motions to help customers proactively achieve outcomes by accelerating customers ability to launch key customer milestones aligned to Outcomes
You build proactive connections with the product teams around key integrations with HRIS and other systems typical to the HR tech stack.
Create programmatic customer insight and product feedback
Organize customer feedback from across CX and help create prioritization schemes for product issues that are impacting customers achieving their Outcomes.
Jointly be accountable with Product and Engineering on driving improvements in customer-centric metrics such as time to resolution
Create cohorts of actionable insights to help guide the product roadmap and minimize toil from customers to achieving Outcomes
Develop and execute key scaling factors to improve the experience while balancing efficiency and cost
Your team has built out an effective offshore strategy to partner with onshore resources to solve customer issues.
You are collaborating with other teams on joint-initiatives in the 1:Many space where Communities and key customer education are being built
You have explored options for additional technologies to help improve and scale the organization with the latest methods of customer engagement
COMPETENCIES

Customer Focus: Ensuring that the organization remains customer-centric and responsive to customer needs and expectations.

Team Leadership: Building and leading high-performing teams fostering collaboration and providing guidance and support to team members.

Strategic Leadership: The ability to formulate and communicate a clear and compelling vision set strategic goals and lead the organization in achieving its long-term objectives.

Results Orientation: A focus on achieving measurable results and holding teams accountable for performance.

Excellent Communicator - Communicates with clarity and empathy. Strong interpersonal skills to maintain your internal and external customer relationships. Ability to communicate to executives project goals requirements and progress to both internal teams and external stakeholders. 

Continuous Learning: Staying current with industry trends emerging technologies and best practices in leadership and management.
DESIRED EXPERIENCE
10+ years of leadership experience
A natural human-centric leadership style with experience in motivating and driving performance for direct and indirect reporting lines
Demonstrated track record of driving results and evolving the skills and capabilities of teams
Demonstrated experience in using advanced engagement techniques to drive customer engagement and experience
Experience working cross-functionally to obtain buy-in must be able to influence stakeholders and get other teams on-board in helping achieve your goals for customers
Experience with leveraging offshore and lower cost profile teams to provide enhanced scale and key capabilities such as multi-language support
Experience with Customer Success platforms like Service Cloud ChurnZero Zendesk
Articulate with excellent verbal and story-telling communication style
Bachelors degree required; graduate level coursework preferred
SAMPLE WEEK IN THE LIFE

Monday: Attend company all-hands sync with leaders across CX to understand various customer journeys that are currently being run. Conduct stand-up meeting with technical services team to review metrics from the week and key priorities

Tuesday: Attend CX leadership team meetings have a 1:1 with the CCO conduct customer meetings work on relevant business and personal objectives meet with Product leaders to sync on latest actions and customer requirements

Wednesday: Attend customer maturity reviews understand which customers are under pressure and where journeys may be leveraged to assist. Join customer meetings or listen to recorded customer briefings.

Thursday: Dedicated deep-work time to strategize conduct customer research catch up on administrative work and conduct customer follow-ups. 

Friday: Fill out 15Five Check-in clear out inbox prioritize for the following week share accomplishments you are proud of detail any challenges and share gratitude by giving teammates a High-Five!
ABOUT 15FIVE
15Five is the holistic performance management company. 15Five equips HR teams with a complete platform solution to improve manager effectiveness drive high performance and engagement and increase retention. 15Five‚Äôs easy-to-use software coaching manager training and community enables HR leaders to continuously measure engagement and performance and empower managers to drive change.At 15Five we focus on building a diverse team that prioritizes inclusivity and celebrates everyone‚Äôs unique identity. We are proud of our thriving hybrid culture that supports a remote-first workplace balanced with distributed office hubs and annual opportunities for all employees to connect in person. We also offer:- Full Medical Dental and Vision Insurance- Flexible Time Off (minimum 3 weeks off every year)- Employer paid Short-Term Long-Term Disability and Term Life- 401K with 4% match at 6 months of employment- Inclusive Benefits Stipend (to help cover some of the gap on medical needs not covered by traditional benefits)- Up to 16 weeks Paid Parental Leave for birth and non-birth parents- 12 paid holidays in 2024- TalkSpace- Wellness Coach App (offers meditation and movement classes courses workshops and panels in a live and interactive setting)- Best Self Time (Last 2 hours of Friday dedicated to your personal self-care/self-growth/recharge activities)- Monthly reimbursement for internet- Sabbatical Program accessed at 5 or 7 Years- We also provide extensive training and development such as strengths discovery and alignment and Manager specific development opportunitiesFor more information see:Our Mission Vision & Values - https://www.15five.com/aboutOur People and Culture - https://www.15five.com/about/careersDiversity Equity Inclusion & Belonging - https://www.15five.com/deibOur Personal & Professional Development Resources - https://www.15five.com/resources/content-libraryReading over the role description and feeling like you don‚Äôt check every box? That‚Äôs okay; if you think you have what it takes but don‚Äôt necessarily meet all the criteria please apply‚Äîyou could be exactly who we are looking for!
15Five follows equitable hiring practices. Our compensation programs are designed to attract motivate and retain talented employees who are highly engaged high performing and have an exceptional impact on the business and our customers.The base salary range displayed on each job posting reflects the minimum and maximum target for new hire salaries for the role across all US locations. We benchmark all roles for compensation in ranges relative to the top half of the market of similar tech companies using up-to-date market data. Within the range individual pay is determined by budget allocated for the role and additional factors including job-related competencies and skills experience and relevant education or training. Please note that the compensation details listed in US job postings reflect the base salary only and do not include bonus equity or benefits. The US new hire base salary range for this full-time role is $173500-$188500 + bonus or commissions + equity + benefits. Note that base salary ranges are reviewed each year based on up-to-date market data and team members who are performing are eligible for a merit increase budget permitting. In compliance with federal law all persons hired will be required to verify identity and eligibility to work in the United States and to complete the required employment eligibility verification document form upon hire.Originally posted on Himalayas

title: Channel Sales Manager
description:
Ready to join the AQ era?
SandboxAQ is solving challenging problems with AI + Quantum for positive impact. We partner with global leaders in government academia and the private sector to identify applications that would benefit from quantum-based applications to current and future commercial challenges. We engage with customers early and throughout the development process to improve market fit.
Our team‚Äôs unique approach enables cross-pollination across a diverse range of fields from physics computer science neuroscience mathematics cryptography natural sciences and more! Our success comes from coalescing diverse talent to create an environment where experimental thinking and collaboration yield breakthrough AI + Quantum solutions. Join a culture where thought leadership diverse talent employee engagement and technological impact will create the next tech uproar.
We are deeply committed to education as a means to advance quantum solutions and computing initiatives. We invest in future talent through internship programs research papers developer tools textbooks educational talks/events and partnerships with universities/talent hubs to attract multi-disciplinary talent. Our hope is to inspire people from all walks of life to be prepared for the quantum era and encourage a path in STEM.
About The Role The Channel Sales Manager is a field sales role that is part of the Global Channel Sales organization. This person will work closely with Global System Integrators Value Added Resellers and Managed Service Providers building focus partner growth plans training partner sales reps and supporting large sales pursuits.  The Channel Sales Manager is a remote based role but will travel approximately 25% of the time to partner locations to do live training strategy sessions and support the development of potential new partnerships. This role will closely align with our Sales Engineering team to achieve key objectives including: number of partner resources trained to sell and demo SandboxAQ solutions joint growth plans with focus partners and qualified pipeline created with partners.Required Qualifications
3-5 years experience selling with and through channel partners
3-5 years carrying a sales quota at a technology company
Past experience working at or with Global System Integrators Managed Service Providers Value Added Resellers. 
Understanding of how partners vet new technology vendors and build joint offerings 
Strong verbal and written communications skills. Ability to deliver a sales pitch in front of a large audience. 
Ability to build a partner commercial model inclusive of discounts rebates and other commercial incentives
Preferred Qualifications
BA/BS degree or equivalent experience.
Experience selling to commercial and public sector customers
Experience building partnerships in commercial and public sector
Foundational understanding of cybersecurity cloud and SaaS
Other Qualifications for the PositionBe comfortable with ambiguity uncertainty and lightly defined activities.  As a start-up we don‚Äôt always have the clarity that is familiar in larger companies. We are the CEOs of our respective domains.

SandboxAQ welcomes all.
We are committed to creating an inclusive culture where we have zero tolerance for discrimination. We invest in our employees personal and professional growth. Once you work with us you can‚Äôt go back to normalcy because great breakthroughs come from great teams and we are the best in quantum technology.
We offer competitive salaries stock options depending on employment type generous learning opportunities medical/dental/vision family planning/fertility PTO (summer and winter breaks) financial wellness resources 401(k) plans and more. 
Equal Employment Opportunity: All qualified applicants will receive consideration regardless of race color ancestry religion sex national origin sexual orientation age citizenship marital status disability gender identity or Veteran status.
Accommodations: we provide reasonable accommodations for individuals with disabilities in job application procedures for open roles. If you need such an accommodation please let a member of our Recruiting team know.

title: Accounts Assistant (Remote/Anywhere)
description:
Collabora is looking for an enthusiastic Accounts Assistant to support our busy Finance team. Working across multiple currencies and time zones no two days are the same. You will be working within a fast paced technical company enjoying a variety of challenging work and the opportunity to study towards an accountancy qualification if you so desire.Main responsibilities are listed below:Sales Ledger
Support and work with the Sales Department to ensure Finance has all required information for project reconciliation and sales invoicing (including completed new client form before sales process is finalised)
Review contracts for new and renewing clients for insurance and invoicing requirements; also ensuring compliance
Ensure Collabora is set up for clients to receive invoices (i.e.: client portal via email etc.)
Set up new clients in Xero with correct currency bank details tax rate and invoicing template
Check sales invoices generated in CRM against recognised revenue on Ordinator/Grafana before being sent out externally
Approve sales invoices in Xero amending dates and invoice templates where necessary
Send invoices to clients via their requested method (email portal etc.)
Proactive credit control ‚Äì working with clients Project Managers and the Sales Team to ensure timely payment of invoices
Customer account reconciliation and continuous review of aged debtors
Ensure USA clients have up to date W-8BEN forms and track expiration of each one
Purchase Ledger and Bank Reconciliation
Processing all purchase invoices  expenses
Supplier statement reconciliation
Set up payments via online banking systems
Reconcile multi-currency bank accounts
Input and reconcile credit cards and Pleo with card holders
Checking to ensure accurate VAT rates have been applied on purchase invoices
Ad-hoc Accounts Duties and Reporting
Assist with duties during absences of other Finance staff
Additional ad-hoc duties as required
Technical Skills: 
Ideally studying towards a relevant accountancy qualification or possess previous experience in a similar role
Experience in managing foreign currencies international tax and VAT issues is desirable 
Working knowledge with Xero is preferable or equivalent accounting system
Competent IT skills including use of spreadsheets and comfortable navigating new systems
Personal Skills:
Good numerical skills  with a demonstrable interest for accountancy 
Ability to prioritise tasks while maintaining accuracy
Great attention to detail 
Ability to work in a small team and take ownership of tasks
Self learning skills to get sufficient knowledge of Collaboras services and systems 
Good English language skills (both verbal and written) 
Ability to work and communicate in an online distributed environment
Remote working experience

title: Remote Mental Health Therapist(LMFT LCSW LPC)
description:
We‚Äôre building a better health system! We‚Äôre making healthcare accessible by delivering integrated primary musculoskeletal and mental health care to patients when they want it through a combination of in-home and virtual visits while also improving the quality of care by eliminating the complexity poor management and time constraints that hold clinicians captive. Building a better health system for all requires the input and perspectives of all. We actively seek a mixture of beliefs backgrounds education and points of view to help us drive better more informed design and business decisions. We are committed to building a diverse inclusive and equitable workforce and we diligently provide equal employment opportunities for all applicants and employees. Mental Health Therapist The Mental Health team has an exciting opportunity for an eager Mental Health Therapist! In this role you‚Äôll work in a team-based approach toward achieving wellness and improved overall health for each individual receiving care with an emphasis on health behavior change for addressing mental illness substance use disorders and comorbid chronic conditions. You will work in a highly collaborative fast-paced startup environment with the primary aim of increasing ease of access to behavioral health services. Primary responsibilities include treating adults completing comprehensive assessments consultation with medical providers and other members of the care team single-session care and outpatient therapy utilizing a multi-session yet brief model of care. Responsibilities
This is a remote contract role for a Mental Health Therapist
As a Mental Health Therapist you will be responsible for providing mental health counseling to clients conducting assessments developing treatment plans and maintaining accurate clinical records
You will also monitor and evaluate treatment progress and adjust treatment plans as needed
As part of a collaborative team you will provide support to your clients in various aspects and communicate with them in an empathetic and compassionate way
RequirementsQualifications
Masters degree or higher in counseling psychology social work or a related field
Therapists must be fully licensed by a State Board to provide therapy independently and without supervision (e.g. LCSW LPC LMFT PsyD or similar credentials)
‚Ä¢ Reliable Internet connection
Ability to work independently manage priorities and meet deadlines while maintaining a high level of accuracy
Strong ethical principles and adherence to legal and regulatory requirements regarding mental health practices
Cultural competence and awareness of diversity equity and inclusion in the mental health field
BenefitsBenefits‚Ä¢ Flexible work schedules‚Ä¢ Full-time/ Part-time position‚Ä¢ In-person flexibility
Generous ‚Äòabove market‚Äô compensation with unlimited/uncapped earnings
‚Ä¢ Collegial work environment‚Ä¢ Strong work/life balance
Annual Compensation range of $75K-$104K
‚Ä¢ Sign on bonus‚Ä¢ Long-term Incentive plan!Originally posted on Himalayas

title: Product Support - Tier 1
description:
Oddball believes that the best products are built when companies understand and value the things they are working on. We value learning and growth and the ability to make a big impact at a small company. We believe that we can make big changes happen and improve the daily lives of millions of people by bringing quality software to the federal space. title: Account Executive Mid-Market, (Benelux)
description:
About Vercel:Vercel‚Äôs Frontend Cloud provides the developer experience and infrastructure to build scale and secure a faster more personalized web. title: AI/ML Systems Analyst
description:
Company DescriptionTechland is one of the biggest and best-known Polish game developers with studios in Wroclaw and Warsaw. For over 30 years weve carried a tradition of providing gamers with unforgettable experiences. Were an international team of over 400 highly-skilled professionals driven by a passion for gaming always striving for the best quality. We‚Äôre fueled by the support of our global community built on the foundation of successful AAA franchises such as Call of Juarez Dead Island or Dying Light. The gamers trust in our games has resulted in our newest project Dying Light 2 Stay Human selling more than 5 million copies across all platforms within the first month after release. On top of continuously growing the world of Dying Light through a robust post-launch support plan for Dying Light 2 Stay Human were also working on an unannounced AAA Open World Action RPG set in a brand new fantasy universe; our biggest project to date. Techlands mission strictly determines every aspect of our work: we want to create unforgettable experiences.Job DescriptionAs an AI/ML Systems Analyst you are the technical backbone for the development implementation and administration of our AI/ML systems. Your role involves deep diving into the technical aspects of AI/ML software ensuring its robust performance and aligning it with our complex data and system architecture.Responsibilities:
analyzing and evaluating the technical aspects of AI/ML software solutions to ensure they meet our operational requirements
spearheading the deployment of AI/ML systems including setup configuration and system integration
administering AI/ML systems to ensure their availability reliability and scalability
collaborating closely with data scientists engineers coders artists and stakeholders to enhance system capabilities
conducting regular system performance checks and coordinating system upgrades with IT teams.
Qualifications
strong technical background with hands-on experience in AI/ML software and systems
proficient in system analysis including performance tuning troubleshooting and optimization
experience in managing the full lifecycle of AI/ML systems deployment from inception to support
advanced knowledge of data management software development and system administration
ability to work in fast-paced cross-disciplinary teams and communicate complex technical information to non-technical colleagues.
Nice to Have:
experience with cloud-based AI/ML solutions and services
familiarity with programming and scripting languages used in AI/ML contexts such as Python R or Scala
knowledge of best practices in data security and privacy particularly as they relate to AI/ML systems.
Additional InformationWhat we can offer:
a wide array of benefits: private medical care life insurance relocation support pro-health campaigns psychological support gifts for different occasions bonuses
an outstanding work atmosphere in a highly-skilled team of professionals with flexible working hours no dress code and full support of the dedicated HR Business Partner
a constant stream of company newsletters PR & project updates so you will always be in the know
many opportunities for personal development: a dedicated development budget for each employee extra two paid days for training and CSR stable career paths extensive internal and external training and financing of English and Polish language classes
state-of-the-art offices filled with chillout zones a fully equipped kitchen a gym (Wroc≈Çaw office) and a free underground car park (Wroc≈Çaw office).

title: business development manager
description:
Trikon is looking forward to hiring a highly experienced individual to join our Operations team as a Business Development Manager.Trikon is an early-phase startup where we aim to build a fully community-driven and decentralized gaming ecosystem where users can access many high-quality gaming choices. Trikon is working on streamlining the user onboarding process and making web3 accessible and more sustainable by building out solutions in the current infrastructure. Our marketplace and Vault solution combines with a unique offering of PoR(Proof-of-Reward) mechanism which makes us achieve the goal by unlocking the potential of Web3 gaming.You will be responsible to conduct market research and working on business development components aligning with different businesses that align with the companys goals and vision. This requires you to keep updated on the latest Market trends and list down the market niche and trends for stronger planning.In this role you will be handling all the Partnerships and Strategies for Trikons Business growth and we expect you to plan co-marketing technical partnerships and strategies according to market trends.If you think you can take up these challenging tasks as a BDM then send us your application right away. We look forward to hearing from you.WHAT WILL YOU BE DOING?
Drive business growth in the Web3 space through developing partnerships identifying new business opportunities and managing relationships with key stakeholders.
Conduct market research and analysis to stay up-to-date on industry trends competitor activity and customer needs.
Utilize existing contacts and build new relationships to identify and prioritize new business opportunities.
Develop and execute go-to-market strategies for Web3 products/services.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams including product engineering and marketing to ensure successful delivery of partnerships and projects.
Provide regular updates to senior leadership on the progress of business development efforts.
Represent the company at industry events conferences and webinars.
WHAT SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE DO YOU NEED?
Excellent communication skills including the ability to write and speak clearly and effectively.
Strong organizational and time management skills with the ability to juggle multiple tasks and projects simultaneously.
Detail-oriented and able to work independently and proactively.
A passion for gaming and web 3.0 technologies with an interest in staying up to date with industry trends and developments.
Strong understanding of Web3 technologies DeFi blockchain and crypto-asset industry.
Proven track record of successful business development and relationship management.
Excellent market research and analytical skills.
Excellent interpersonal written and verbal communication skills.
Ability to work in a fast-paced and dynamic environment.
Good contacts in the Web3 and DeFi industry

title: Senior Analyst, Medical Economics
description:
About TailorCare

TailorCare is transforming the experience of specialty care. Our comprehensive care program takes a deeply personal evidence-based approach to improving patient outcomes for joint back and muscle conditions. By combining a careful assessment of patients‚Äô symptoms health histories preferences and goals with predictive data and latest evidence-based guidelines we help patients choose‚Äîand navigate‚Äîthe most effective treatment pathway for them every step of the way.
TailorCare values the experiences and perspectives of individuals from all backgrounds. We are a highly collaborative curious and determined team passionate about scaling a high-growth start-up to improve the lives of those in pain. TailorCare is a remote-first company with hybrid offices in New York City and Nashville.
About the RoleTailorCare is looking for a Senior Analyst of Medical Economics to join our Actuarial/MedEcon team. You will play an integral role in the evaluation and enhancement of TailorCare‚Äôs MSK intervention strategies. You will partner with our clinical and operations teams to evaluate current performance and research new opportunities to positively impact the patients we serve. You will also partner with Finance team members to evaluate the financial performance of our value based care contracts.  This is a high impact role at TailorCare with ample opportunity within a growing start-up.  Primary Responsibilities
Support clinical analytics and finance leaders across the organization to develop forecast and track population health and care management programs
Support the development of ad-hoc reporting and monitoring processes for a variety of care model programs
Use historical population level data to create and asses performance outcomes (costs and utilization) to identify areas of opportunity
Interpret and analyze data from multiple sources including claims provider member and encounters data to identify and assess the business impact of trends
Develop and troubleshoot complex scripts and reports using SQL Excel or other analytics tools
Produce monthly VBC financial reporting including IBNR estimates for finance
Develop models to support various actuarial population health and financial analysis across enterprise
Qualifications
5 + years of experience working in an analytical role within the healthcare industry (preferably at Medicare risk bearing entity such as a health plan or Medicare ACO/Value Based Care entity)
5 + years of experience using SQL to analyze eligibility and medical claims data  
Experience with healthcare coding standards including CPT HCPCS ICD10 Procedure ICD10 Diagnostic DRG MS-DRG APR-DRG etc.
Ability to build excel reporting models to summarize and present healthcare eligibility and claims costs data
Good communication skills with comfort presenting within the team
Bachelors degree in business analytics economics statistics mathematics actuarial science public health health informatics healthcare administration finance or related field or equivalent experienc

Whats In It For You

Meaningful work each day we care deeply about our mission our patients and each-other. 
Work from anywhere in the US that best fits your lifestyle or for those that enjoy an in-person environment join teammates in our hybrid hubs in NYC or Nashville. 
Rich PTO and holiday plans to ensure you have time away to rest and recharge
We offer paid parental leave support a healthy work-life integration and offer work flexibility ‚Äì we love to talk about our pets and families.
Medical dental vision life disability wellness resources and an employer HSA contribution all from Day 1. 
We are committed to fair and equitable pay for all employees and we help you achieve your future goals with an employer match 401k.
An inclusive workplace where you can lean on your teammates offer candid feedback and bring your true self to work each day. 

TailorCare seeks to recruit and retain staff from diverse backgrounds and encourages qualified candidates to apply. TailorCare is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of age sex gender identity/expression sexual orientation color race creed national origin ancestry religion marital status political belief physical or mental disability pregnancy military or veteran status.

title: Customer Success Manager
description:
Transfr is on a mission to create alternative pathways to career success. Our hands-on simulation-based training provides people with the skills they need to enter or reenter the workforce enabling them to have a better quality of life.  Our technology gives immersive training that the user absorbs much more readily than video tutorials slide presentations and other training methods.  We believe the future starts with innovative workplace training and hands-on skills development. We‚Äôre building bridges between schools workplaces and governments to make jobs more accessible and create a better tomorrow today. This is an exciting time! Demand for VR skills-based training has never been higher. Our startup is in hyper growth mode scaling in every direction. We are looking for people that possess a true love for learning and have a burning desire to contribute to outcomes that change the world.
Summary: To complement our rapid growth we are seeking to add a Customer Success Manager to our Customer Experience (CX) division. This role will ensure assigned customer base derives value from our products primarily leveraging digital communication channels and self-service resources to facilitate customer success. This Customer Success Manager plays a critical role in minimizing churn and maximizing customer retention in a scalable and efficient manner. The Customer Success Manager will report to a Manager of Customer Success.Key Responsibilities:
Drive product adoption utilization and expansion opportunities using customer data and analytics to monitor utilization and customer health identify patterns hindering adoption and engage at-risk accounts with strategies to prevent churn and ensure customer satisfaction.
Deliver on 90%+ annual subscription renewals by maximizing clients success with our products and engaging customers well in advance of renewal dates to secure on time renewals.
Manage a steady volume of email and phone conversations with a large customer portfolio across different lifecycle stages.
Develop and maintain self-service resources to empower customers to independently find solutions. 
Create scalable nurture campaigns that decrease time to value increase product adoption and inform customers. 
Ensure a seamless onboarding process for customers by providing resources guides tutorials support and training webinars.
Become knowledgeable of Transfr‚Äôs solutions and service offerings including implementation methodologies and advanced service offerings to provide accurate and relevant information to customers.
Create QBR and annual reports that demonstrate the value creation unique for each customer.
Secure customer feedback and share internally to influence product roadmap.
Leverage a mix of automated and manual processes to maintain information flow externally and internally document all aspects of customer accounts.  
Improve on business metrics to measure Transfr‚Äôs impact NPS training likeability and other metrics to provide Transfr with insight into the health of its customer relationships and areas to improve.
Requirements:
At least 4 years of experience in customer success or account management.
Exceptional prioritization and organizational capabilities to manage all aspects of a $2M+/- book of business.
Ability to work independently and manage multiple customer relationships simultaneously.
Technically adaptive with capability to learn new solutions features/functionality and communicate those in a value-added way to customers.
Superior verbal and written communication abilities.
Adept in identifying customer risks and proactively engaging customers to equip them with solutions.
Strong presentation negotiation problem-solving and analytical skills. 
Continuous learning mindset and detail-oriented approach to the Transfr mission to create jobs.
Proven track record of consistently exceeding objectives - self-motivated and driven by results.
Experience with SAAS renewals preferably in EdTech.
What we offerThe base salary range for this position is expected to be between $80000 and $100000 with the actual base salary amount dependent on a number of factors including but not limited to a candidate‚Äôs credentials relevant experience and primary job location. In addition to salary this role may be eligible for variable compensation and additional company benefits such as stock options 401(k) paid vacation and sick time and medical/dental/vision insurance.In Closing:If youre looking to make a big difference in the lives of others we invite you to join us on our mission to make learning more intuitive by helping individuals develop the skills they need for career success. Be a part of creating pathways to prosperity by helping to develop training simulations to teach skills that lead to well-paying jobs for all.At Transfr we embrace diversity because it breeds innovation. Transfr is an equal opportunity employer that participates in E-Verify committed to providing equal employment opportunities to all applicants consultants and employees and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race color religion age national origin disability status genetics protected veteran status sexual orientation gender identity or expression or any other characteristic protected by federal state or local laws.**Must be authorized to work in the United States without restriction**Learn more at transfrinc.com
