title: Business Analyst, Sales Analytics
description:
Company DescriptionSince we opened our doors in 2009 the world of commerce has evolved immensely and so has Square. After enabling anyone to take payments and never miss a sale we saw sellers stymied by disparate outmoded products and tools that wouldn‚Äôt work together.So we expanded into software and started building integrated omnichannel solutions ‚Äì to help sellers sell online manage inventory offer buy now pay later functionality through Afterpay book appointments engage loyal buyers and hire and pay staff. Across it all we‚Äôve embedded financial services tools at the point of sale so merchants can access a business loan and manage their cash flow in one place. Afterpay furthers our goal to provide omnichannel tools that unlock meaningful value and growth enabling sellers to capture the next generation shopper increase order sizes and compete at a larger scale.Today we are a partner to sellers of all sizes ‚Äì large enterprise-scale businesses with complex operations sellers just starting as well as merchants who began selling with Square and have grown larger over time. As our sellers grow so do our solutions. There is a massive opportunity in front of us. We‚Äôre building a significant meaningful and lasting business and we are helping sellers worldwide do the same.Job DescriptionThe Strategy & Analytics team within Sales & Account Management is building the data-driven programs and technology to increase team efficiency and effectiveness and improve the experience of businesses that use Square‚Äôs ecosystem of products. We are a team of Analysts Technical Program Managers and Program Managers who work closely with Sales & AM stakeholders Automation Marketing and Customer Success to drive progress against our organizational and company-wide priorities. As a Business Analyst focusing on Sales you will report to the Sales & Analytics Lead and identify areas of opportunity to increase new seller acquisition improve the efficiency and impact of the team develop metrics and robust data visualizations to understand team performance and contribute to the organization‚Äôs global growth strategy. We‚Äôre looking for individuals who have a passion for diving into data summarizing trends and making an impact.You will:
Use data to drive analysis and actionable recommendations to shape program design operations and strategy
Partner with Sales leadership strategic finance team to set performance targets define KPIs create scalable reporting and provide insight to drivers of pacing against goals
Evaluate the performance of new and existing sales GTM strategies
Drive financial analysis to understand the productivity of the Account Executive team and inform resourcing and future investments across Sales programs
QualificationsYou Have:
2-4 years of analytical experience at a high-growth tech company in a analytics/corporate strategy/business operations role or at a top management consulting company with a exposure to Sales/GTM assignments 
Proficiency with data analytics and visualization technologies - Snowflake SQL and Looker equivalents
Experience applying quantitative analysis and logical reasoning to influence business outcomes
Strong written and verbal communication skills and the ability to build relationships and influence across the organization
Highly analytical adept at finding trends and summarizing key insights from ambiguous data sets
Additional InformationBlock takes a market-based approach to pay and pay may vary depending on your location. U.S. locations are categorized into one of four zones based on a cost of labor index for that geographic area. The successful candidate‚Äôs starting pay will be determined based on job-related skills experience qualifications work location and market conditions. These ranges may be modified in the future.Zone A: USD $114200 - USD $139600Zone B: USD $106200 - USD $129800Zone C: USD $97100 - USD $118700Zone D: USD $85700 - USD $104700To find a location‚Äôs zone designation please refer to this resource. If a location of interest is not listed please speak with a recruiter for additional information. Full-time employee benefits include the following:
Healthcare coverage (Medical Vision and Dental insurance)
Health Savings Account and Flexible Spending Account
Retirement Plans including company match 
Employee Stock Purchase Program
Wellness programs including access to mental health 1:1 financial planners and a monthly wellness allowance 
Paid parental and caregiving leave
Paid time off (including 12 paid holidays)
Paid sick leave (1 hour per 26 hours worked (max 80 hours per calendar year to the extent legally permissible) for non-exempt employees and covered by our Flexible Time Off policy for exempt employees) 
Learning and Development resources
Paid Life insurance AD&D and disability benefits 
These benefits are further detailed in Blocks policies. This role is also eligible to participate in Blocks equity plan subject to the terms of the applicable plans and policies and may be eligible for a sign-on bonus. Sales roles may be eligible to participate in a commission plan subject to the terms of the applicable plans and policies. Pay and benefits are subject to change at any time consistent with the terms of any applicable compensation or benefit plans.US and Canada EEOC StatementWe‚Äôre working to build a more inclusive economy where our customers have equal access to opportunity and we strive to live by these same values in building our workplace. Block is a proud equal opportunity employer. We work hard to evaluate all employees and job applicants consistently without regard to race color religion gender national origin age disability pregnancy gender expression or identity sexual orientation citizenship or any other legally protected class. We believe in being fair and are committed to an inclusive interview experience including providing reasonable accommodations to disabled applicants throughout the recruitment process. We encourage applicants to share any needed accommodations with their recruiter who will treat these requests as confidentially as possible. Want to learn more about what we‚Äôre doing to build a workplace that is fair and square? Check out our I+D page.Additionally we consider qualified applicants with criminal histories for employment on our team and always assess candidates on an individualized basis.We‚Äôve noticed a rise in recruiting impersonations across the industry where individuals are sending fake job offer emails. Contact from any of our recruiters or employees will always come from an email address ending with @block.xyz @squareup.com @tidal.com or @afterpay.com @clearpay.co.uk.Block Inc. (NYSE: SQ) is a global technology company with a focus on financial services. Made up of Square Cash App Spiral TIDAL and TBD we build tools to help more people access the economy. Square helps sellers run and grow their businesses with its integrated ecosystem of commerce solutions business software and banking services. With Cash App anyone can easily send spend or invest their money in stocks or Bitcoin. Spiral (formerly Square Crypto) builds and funds free open-source Bitcoin projects. Artists use TIDAL to help them succeed as entrepreneurs and connect more deeply with fans. TBD is building an open developer platform to make it easier to access Bitcoin and other blockchain technologies without having to go through an institution.While there is no specific deadline to apply for this role on average U.S. open roles are posted for 70 days before being filled by a successful candidate.Originally posted on Himalayas

title: Compensation Business Partner Lead
description:
Job DescriptionJoin the team redefining how the world experiences design.Hey gday mabuhay kia ora ‰Ω†Â•Ω hallo v√≠tejte!Thanks for stopping by. We know job hunting can be a little time consuming and youre probably keen to find out whats on offer so well get straight to the point.Where and how you can workOur flagship campus is in Sydney. We also have a campus in Melbourne and co-working spaces in Brisbane Perth and Adelaide. But you have choice in where and how you work. That means if you want to do your thing in the office (if youre near one) at home or a bit of both its up to you however we have a preference for Sydney.About the Total Reward TeamOur Total Rewards programs play a key role in our mission to build the world‚Äôs best team. They allow us to attract recognise and retain incredible team members who care about living our values and having a tremendous impact by using their skills to achieve our huge goals.The Total Rewards team is responsible for working on some of Canva‚Äôs most impactful operational goals. We‚Äôre focused on boosting Canva‚Äôs effectiveness and engagement with an eye on profitability and scale through the design and implementation of unique Reward and Benefits programs.Our Total Rewards team is made up of Program Managers Compensation Analysts and Compensation Business Partners who are currently all Sydney & Melbourne based. About the roleAs a champion of Canvas values youll collaborate with various teams including Compensation HR Business Partners and Talent Acquisition to shape and enhance both new and existing programs. Your pivotal role involves crafting and executing reward strategies designing solutions to enhance employee experience and boost business performance.Leading a team of Compensation Business Partners youll be instrumental in establishing foundational partnerships and scaling our reward programs and guiding a growing team. With your strategic mindset youll implement and propose changes to compensation programs and offer guidance and strategic partnership. What you‚Äôd be doing in this roleAs Canva scales change continues to be part of our DNA. But we like to think thats all part of the fun. So this will give you the flavour of the type of things youll be working on when you start but this will likely evolve.At the moment this role is focused on:
Leading end-to-end implementation of cutting-edge programs seamlessly blending analysis stakeholder engagement project management communications and change management.
Partnering with leaders to understand org design changes and proactively identify necessary adjustments that will enhance the job architecture and its governance.
Leveraging market insights to align Canvas roles with external benchmarks conducting annual reviews to fine-tune structures managing salary and equity compensation effectively.
Driving Canvas reward cycle from impactful communications to leadership collaboration and execution of outcomes alongside the Reward team and HR Ops.
Collaborating with Talent Acquisition for a streamlined partnership ensuring fair and consistent reviews of job offers.
Informing and supporting Canva‚Äôs reward education programs and delivering engaging and impactful education to help Canvanauts understand our reward philosophy and programs.
Playing a pivotal role as a coach and mentor contributing to the growth and development of the team.
You‚Äôre probably a match if
You have experience and a strong depth of knowledge of the tech sector (experience partnering closely with engineering and/or product teams is preferable).
You‚Äôve successfully coached and led compensation teams.
You have extensive experience in the reward field and a deep understanding of the role reward programs play in talent attraction and retention.
You‚Äôre passionate about the impact of rewards on employee strategies and business outcomes.
You‚Äôre skilled in prioritising leading and tracking multiple projects in a collaborative high-growth environment.
You enjoy being the key point of contact for business adept at building relationships and inspiring teams.
you‚Äôre a true people person with excellent relationship building collaboration and problem solving skills.
You‚Äôre able to balance people skills with attention to detail and data affinity.
You thrive on building programs from design to implementation setting up scalable systems for a global workforce.
Whats in it for you?Achieving our crazy big goals motivates us to work hard - and we do - but youll experience lots of moments of magic connectivity and fun woven throughout life at Canva too. We also offer a stack of benefits to set you up for every success in and outside of work.Heres a taste of whats on offer:-Equity packages - we want our success to be yours tooInclusive parental leave policy that supports all parents & carers-An annual Vibe & Thrive allowance to support your wellbeing social connection office setup & more-Flexible leave options that empower you to be a force for good take time to recharge and supports you personallyCheck out lifeatcanva.com for more info.Other stuff to knowWe make hiring decisions based on your experience skills and passion as well as how you can enhance Canva and our culture. When you apply please tell us the pronouns you use and any reasonable adjustments you may need during the interview process.Originally posted on Himalayas

title: Solutions Architect - West/Mountains
description:
About the Job:Solutions Architects at LaunchDarkly are an elite team in our Professional Services organization who help companies achieve progressive delivery. You will be a key contributor to the Revenue team applying technical product expertise to build relevant solutions for LaunchDarkly customers. You will be the go-to technical resource for the account team and customers working in a mix of paid Professional Services engagements and being a trusted advisor to organizations on an ongoing basis.By joining LaunchDarkly you will work with software development teams at some of the most advanced companies across industries including Technology Finance  Insurance Pharmaceuticals  Life Science Entertainment and more.  LaunchDarkly is a rapidly growing software company with a strong mission and vision carried out by a talented and diverse team of employees. Our goal is to help teams build better software faster. Youll join a small but growing team from companies like Atlassian Intercom and GitHub and youll have an immediate impact on our product and customers.Responsibilities:
Couple technical knowledge with a consultative mindset to understand customer needs gather requirements and influence decisions.
Deliver Professional Services engagements aimed at helping the companies we work with improve how they deliver software.
Advise our customers on software development best practices and how to leverage LaunchDarkly to ship software more frequently and with reduced risk. 
Create a foundation for a strong technical partnership between LaunchDarkly and customers.
Solve technical hurdles that are impeding value realization.
Become a subject matter expert on LaunchDarkly.
Advocate for our customers by translating aggregating and representing customer feedback to the Product and Engineering teams.
Qualifications:
You have a hands-on technical background with a consultative approach.
You learn and synthesize large amounts of information and are adept at acquiring the context you need to make prescriptive recommendations to our customers.
You have the ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously but the discipline and focus to know where you attention is most needed.
You are a self‚Äêstarter and excited to take on hard problems. 
You are passionate about helping customers and have a strong sense of ownership.
You can effectively communicate with experts from different backgrounds and build strong stakeholder relationships.
You have a technical background and are interested in a customer-facing role.
You are a deeply curious individual who is not comfortable with just getting enough context to give an answer. You feel the need to understand how things work underneath.
You are familiar with the software development lifecycle. 
You are comfortable with at least one of our supported Client-side SDK languages (preferably Javascript)
You are familiar with DevOps Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery. 
You have worked with the services of one of the major cloud providers (AWS Azure GCP). 
You have worked with Linux Docker and Virtual Machines.
Pay:Target pay range for a Level 3 in the US western and mountain regions: $139000 - $164000 *On Target Earnings (OTE) includes base pay and commission**Restricted Stock Units (RSUs) health vision and dental insurance and mental health benefits in addition to salary.LaunchDarkly operates from a place of high trust and transparency; we are happy to state the pay range for our open roles to best align with your needs. Exact compensation may vary based on skills experience degree level and location.About LaunchDarkly:Modern software delivery was supposed to be the foundation for a thriving digital business but reality has proven otherwise. Slow inefficient development cycles costly outages and fragmented customer experiences are preventing developers from building their best software. The LaunchDarkly platform helps developers innovate on new features faster while protecting them with a safety valve to instantly rewind when things go wrong. Developers can target product experiences to any customer segment and maximize the business impact of every feature. And by gradually rolling out new application components they escape nightmare big-bang technology migrations. The LaunchDarkly platform was built to guide engineers to the next frontier of DevOps by:
Improving the velocity and stability of software releases without the fear of end customer outages
Delivering targeted experiences by easily personalizing features to customer cohorts
Maximizing the business impact of every feature through the ability to experiment and optimize
Coordinating the release and optimization of software to provide consistent experiences across mobile platforms and device types
Improving the effectiveness and productivity of engineering teams by providing insights into engineering cadence and stability
At LaunchDarkly we believe in the power of teams. Were building a team that is humble open collaborative respectful and kind. We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race religion color national origin gender gender identity sexual orientation age marital status veteran status or disability status.One of our company values is Widen the Circle. Which means we seek out diversity of perspectives to get best results. We understand everyone has their own unique talents and experiences. We encourage you to apply to this role even if you don‚Äôt think you meet 100% of the qualifications outlined above. We can find out together if its the right match for your skillset.Do you need a disability accommodation?Fill out this accommodations request form and someone from our People Operations team will contact you for assistance. Originally posted on Himalayas

title: Sr. Technical API Curriculum Developer
description:
Company DescriptionA career that‚Äôs the whole package!At Conga we‚Äôve built a community where our colleagues can thrive. Here you‚Äôll find opportunities to innovate support for growth through individual and team development and an environment where all voices can be heard.Conga crushes complexity within an increasingly complex world. With our revenue lifecycle management solution we transform your unique complexities for order configuration execution fulfillment and contract renewal processes with a single critical insights data model that adapts to ever-changing business requirements and aligns the understanding and efforts of every team.Our mission: Empower customers to deliver transformational revenue growth by aligning teams processes and technology to maximize customer lifetime value.Our approach is grounded in the Conga Way a framework for what we stand for and everything we do as an organization ‚Äî from hiring to decision making and product development. Developed with direct input from our colleagues the Conga Way is the foundation for our culture.Job DescriptionJob Title: Sr. Technical API Curriculum DeveloperLocations: RemoteReports to: Manager Curriculum DevelopmentA quick snapshot‚Ä¶
The Sr. API Technical Curriculum Developer is a key member on the curriculum development team responsible for delivering courses for our API products that are focused on the Revenue Lifecycle.  In this role you will learn the Conga‚Äôs Revenue Lifecycle the business process it solves such as configuring carts pricing quoting and other document generation.  You will also learn about our various customers and common industry use cases to build curriculum.  You will use your skills to develop any content that is programmatic in nature.  If there is functionality that requires scripting querying or coding you will help with the development of that curriculum along with SMEs.  For example our document generation product has a suite of APIs to automate a business‚Äôs documentation process.  You may look at the APIs and create training on how to generate a document retrieve the status of the generated document and then have the document be downloaded by a button. In this example you are free to develop examples in Python JavaScript Node or a lightweight language where the focus is on our APIs and schema.  When working on some of our other products you will be required to develop examples in C#. Why it‚Äôs a big deal‚Ä¶ As a Sr. Technical API Curriculum Developer you will play a critical role in designing developing and delivering comprehensive curriculum focused on Conga‚Äôs APIs along with front-end development. Your code development and instructional design expertise will help us educate our developers and technical professionals to harness the full potential of our API products. You need to be comfortable researching technical topics collaborating with SMEs designing and writing course material.  You will develop curriculum that translates technical topics into concise and simple modules for a range of audiences.  You will ensure that content is technically correct and aligns with our product roadmap. Conga is releasing a suite of new products in its Revenue Lifecycle Management portfolio and some are API only products.  We want to make sure that our customers are successful by not only providing them with documentation but training as well.  You will be an integral part of the success of Conga‚Äôs API only products.  You will help deliver first rate training for our APIs to complement our documentation and ensure our customer‚Äôs success.  Are you the person we‚Äôre looking for? Curriculum Development. 5 years of experience with curriculum development for technical software or 5 years of code development and examples of documentation and training you produced at a software company. Expertise in creating and updating curriculum materials including tutorials guides and documentation examples to teach our API products.  Including development concepts and best practices aligning curriculum content with the latest industry standards for API training. You will also develop curriculum for more technical parts of our platform.  Collaboration. Experience working closely with subject matter experts technical teams and other stakeholders to gather information and ensure the accuracy of curriculum materials. Collaborating with multimedia specialists and instructional designers to enhance the learning experience.Development Expertise. Develop hands-on exercises and projects that allow learners to apply Conga APIs to real-world scenarios. Experience or ability to develop curricula content using C#. Experience with Swagger and Working knowledge in JSON data exchange Web Service and REST APIs. You‚Äôll be asked to provide examples of training you developed on topics that includes APIs REST Postman Swagger XML Mulesoft etc. The position will require the ability to pass a small project that demonstrates your development skills.Instructional Design. Expertise in applying instructional design principles to create engaging and effective learning experiences. Experience using a variety of instructional methods and delivery formats to accommodate diverse learning styles.Assessment and Feedback. Experience in developing assessments and quizzes to evaluate learners comprehension. Gathering feedback from learners and instructors to continuously improve curriculum content.Education. A technical degree in Computer Science or Software Engineering or a 6 years of relevant work experience in a technical industry.Related tools and software. Strong communication and presentation skills using Microsoft Word PowerPoint Articulate Snag-It and Camtasia. Here‚Äôs what will give you an edge‚Ä¶Related tools and software. Familiarity with Docebo learning management systems (LMS). Knowledge of Quote to Cash processes and the Revenue Management Lifecycle.Did we pique your interest?‚ÄØ If this sounds like the kind of job you would love in the kind of environment where you would thrive please click apply. Wed love to hear from you! ‚ÄØ Compensation In the spirit of the Conga Way we strive to design easy-to-understand compensation programs that are fair and free from any type of discrimination.  In keeping with this approach we are committed to delivering competitive compensation and benefits packages to our colleagues worldwide and communicating transparently about the structure of our compensation programs.The U.S. base salary range for this full-time position is $75519 - $120831. Within the range individual pay is determined by job-related skills experience and relevant education or training. In addition to base salary Conganeers receive a variable incentive pay component perks such as flexible work options and a full range of benefits including medical and dental insurance. The posted salary ranges are for the expectations outlined in the job description.  We are often open to a wide variety of profiles and sometimes have flexibility within our organizational structure to adjust the role responsibilities up or down should we select a candidate that is less or more experienced than the posted job requirements.  In these occasional cases we will communicate the revised salary range to the candidate during the selection process.#BI-RemoteAdditional InformationConga is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer and provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants regardless of race color religion gender gender identity age national origin disability parental or pregnancy status marriage and civil partnership sexual orientation veteran status or any other characteristic protected by law. Reasonable accommodations will be made to meet the requirements of the Americans with Disabilities Act and will be provided as requested by candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines. Conga is not open to third party solicitation or resumes for our posted FTE positions. Resumes received from third party agencies that are unsolicited will be considered complimentary.Originally posted on Himalayas

title: Solutions Architect
description:
Company DescriptionAt ServiceNow our technology makes the world work for everyone and our people make it possible. We move fast because the world can‚Äôt wait and we innovate in ways no one else can for our customers and communities. By joining ServiceNow you are part of an ambitious team of change makers who have a restless curiosity and a drive for ingenuity. We know that your best work happens when you live your best life and share your unique talents so we do everything we can to make that possible. We dream big together supporting each other to make our individual and collective dreams come true. The future is ours and it starts with you. With more than 7700+ customers we serve approximately 85% of the Fortune 500¬Æ and were proud to be one of FORTUNE 100 Best Companies to Work For¬Æ and Worlds Most Admired Companies‚Ñ¢.Learn more on Life at Now blog and hear from our employees about their experiences working at ServiceNow.Unsure if you meet all the qualifications of a job description but are deeply excited about the role? We still encourage you to apply! At ServiceNow we are committed to creating an inclusive environment where all voices are heard valued and respected. We welcome all candidates including individuals from non-traditional varied backgrounds that might not come from a typical path connected to this role. We believe skills and experience are transferrable and the desire to dream big makes for great candidates.Job DescriptionSolutions Architect Customer Outcomes GTM team has a need to have a role in driving complex strategic deals and engage at an executive level in solution designs for large enterprise workflows such as Order to Cash Procure to Pay Hire to Retire Record to Report etc.This role would be charged with engaging with Services Account Executive to have executive-level conversations and evangelize the platform‚Äôs current and emerging capabilities.The role would need to engage closely with the Solution Consultant (+Enterprise Architecture and Inspire when present) assigned to a customer to ensure the account and implementation strategy lead to the same vision.In addition the role will be responsible for engaging with ServiceNow‚Äôs executive team to understand and contribute to innovation opportunities in the market and platform.  The Services Sales Architect will also participate in industry solutioning across verticals such as FinServ Manufacturing Technology etc.   What you get to do in this role:
Provide technical and strategic thought leadership to clients in partnership with the Services Account Executives on how to best leverage ServiceNow Technologies. 
Develop deep personal relationships with clients and be a ‚Äòtrusted advisor‚Äô. 
Engage with Services Account Executives and SW sales teams to craft beneficial commercial relationships to our clients and partner ecosystem. 
Engage with the strategy office and industry vertical teams to participate in innovation and future capabilities. 
Participate in large Services and Licensing pursuits.  
You will integrate with the Delivery community & learn how the Expert Services team operates to deliver high-quality and effective solutions for our customers.  
You will create customer-facing deliverables describing services proposals and Statements of Work helping customers achieve successful business outcomes. 
You will lead the implementation strategy solutioning with the customer to ensure an at-scale product adoption and create even more demand for the ServiceNow platform.
QualificationsTo be successful in this role you have:
15+ years experience in the IT Services industry.

ServiceNow experience - minimum of 3-5 years
Demonstrable experience in positioning strategic implementation platform strategies for professional services 
Consultative sales experience as an Enterprise Architect in IT or customer environment.
Strong know-how on implementing platform strategies in Greenfield Back2Baseline and integration scenarios
Ability to collaborate and build strong relationships within the internal and external ecosystem ensuring proper engagement with core teams and customers
Skilled at concisely summarizing salient points to executives and thorough understanding of cloud application technology and trends
Validated track record of meeting and exceeding quota and key success metrics
Ability to segment opportunities and complex deal situations and identify appropriate investment of resources
Cross-functional teamwork skills. Able to navigate tough conversations and challenging meetings with business partners
Display a balance of strategic and tactual skills with a high level of intellectual agility.
Strong focus on ownership and execution against deadlines while managing multiple opportunities at a time.
Additional InformationServiceNow is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race color creed religion sex sexual orientation national origin or nationality ancestry age disability gender identity or expression marital status veteran status or any other category protected by law.At ServiceNow we lead with flexibility and trust in our distributed world of work. Click here to learn about our work personas: flexible remote and required-in-office.If you require a reasonable accommodation to complete any part of the application process or are limited in the ability or unable to access or use this online application process and need an alternative method for applying you may contact us at talent.acquisition@servicenow.com for assistance.For positions requiring access to technical data subject to export control regulations including Export Administration Regulations (EAR) ServiceNow may have to obtain export licensing approval from the U.S. Government for certain individuals. All employment is contingent upon ServiceNow obtaining any export license or other approval that may be required by the U.S. Government.Please Note: Fraudulent job postings/job scams are increasingly common. Click here to learn what to watch out for and how to protect yourself. All genuine ServiceNow job postings can be found through the ServiceNow Careers site.From Fortune. ¬© 2022 Fortune Media IP Limited All rights reserved. Used under license.Fortune and Fortune Media IP Limited are not affiliated with and do not endorse products or services of ServiceNow.Originally posted on Himalayas

title: Quality Assurance Analyst Intern
description:
About Super.com
We started Super.com to help maximize lives‚Äìboth the lives of our customers and the lives of our employees‚Äì so that everyone can experience all that life has to offer. For our employees our promise is that Super.com is more than just a job; it‚Äôs an opportunity to unlock one‚Äôs potential where learning is celebrated and impact is realized.  We are more than a fast-paced high-growth tech company; we care about our people and take career progression seriously. This is your career and our aim is to supercharge it through the people the work and the programs that fuel who we are.About the Role:We are looking for a Quality Assurance Analyst to join our team.  You‚Äôll directly contribute to Super.com‚Äôs growth and success by validating that our applications meet design specifications and requirements.   You will advocate for our customers and help us build amazing experiences and value into our products.  You‚Äôll participate in fast-moving Agile teams helping to both develop and implement test scenarios and test strategies in aid of our engineering releases.  You‚Äôll provide manual testing and QA guidance for multiple product verticals and projects.  Your work will contribute directly towards operational metrics for both your immediate and extended teams.  And you will help ensure that our products and experiences meet the highest quality for our customers.Challenges Youll Solve
Help the team with the creation and execution of test cases
Investigate test failures and log defects in JIRA
Effectively communicate test activities tasks and status
Perform Exploratory Testing Sessions to help identify issues in Production
Participate in daily scrums weekly sprint refining sessions and all sprint rituals for each of your Mission Aligned Teams
Contribute to Functional and Regression testing for your assigned areas
Provide critical feedback on project documentation to help the team improve its products and processes
About You
1+ years in Software Quality Assurance
Ability to write test cases and defects
Ability to read understand and utilize test plans
Ability to follow directions and ask good questions
Excellent English verbal and written communication skills
Highly motivated with a willingness to learn
Team player - works well with different roles and teams
Strong attention to detail
Bonus Points
Experience with the Jira defect management system
Experience testing mobile applications
Experience with release management tasks and systems
Experience working with test case management systems
Weve Got You Covered
Compensation: We pay our Interns top-of-market
$300 one-time home office set up allowance
$25/week UberEats allowance on Fridays
$300/Term Learning and Development allowance
$120/ Term Fitness/Wellness allowance
Top Talent: work with the best in the world including Engineers and Leadership from Google Meta Wish YouTube Uber and more.
Build Something Great: most importantly build a product used by millions around the world - have ownership have impact and do great work.
We Believe in Equal OpportunityWe are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race religion color national origin gender sexual orientation age marital status veteran status or disability status. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. If needed please notify our Talent Acquisition Partner.Originally posted on Himalayas

title: Data Operations Analyst
description:
About the CompanyKoBold Metals is a mineral exploration company using AI to explore for the metals we need for our transition to a low-carbon economy. KoBold‚Äôs business is discovering defining expanding and developing mineral resources and KoBold‚Äôs objective is to achieve a step-change improvement in exploration success: we aim to discover more tier 1 resources faster and with fewer failures.KoBold has a global portfolio of more than 50 exploration properties targeting nickel copper cobalt and lithium which range from 100%-owned to partnerships with both majors junior explorers and prospectors.Our team includes the best of the industry in exploration geoscience data science software engineering operations and business personnel. Prior to joining KoBold KoBold team members have made nearly 20 discoveries. Our exploration programs are co-led by our geoscientists and data scientists who develop exploration hypotheses rigorously quantify uncertainty in our understanding of the subsurface and design data collection programs that most effectively reduce uncertainty drawing upon a large suite of proprietary exploration technology built by our data scientists and software engineers. Our field programs validate and improve the system and have demonstrated material improvements over conventional exploration methods.KoBold is privately held and our investors include institutional asset managers T. Rowe Rice and Canada Pension Plan Investments; technology venture capitalists Andreessen Horowitz Bill Gates‚Äôs Breakthrough Energy Ventures BOND Capital Standard Investments and Sam Altman‚Äôs Apollo Projects; and leading natural resources companies Equinor Mitsubishi and BHP.We are hiring a Data Operations Analyst to help accelerate our mission.About the position:This role will support the Head of Operations Data and the Director of Mineral Rights in an effort to organize and enrich the data operations quality management and visibility at KoBold with a particular focus on mineral rights-related data.You will help to create easy pathways for data access and visibility whether that‚Äôs through a new application building an in-house suite of tools identifying a gap and working with project teams to find new solutions etc. As the Operations Data Analyst you will work closely with the Head Operations Data to support existing tools and data access analyze new datasets and determine the best way to provide insight opportunities for project and operations teams and be available for teaching guiding and troubleshooting any data access issues that arise.You will also work closely with the Director of Mineral Rights to maintain onboard/offboard and analyze mineral tenure including updating reporting and conducting data management on various systems to make sure that tenure surface rights and environmental information is complete accurate and available to project teams.Qualifications
Expert/advanced in manipulating formatting and organizing raw data (in Excel/Sheets/databases etc.)
A proponent of collecting and analyzing metadata usage and patterns on data and applications
Savvy with GIS systems (including ArcGIS QGIS etc.)
Familiarity with database systems (preferably PostgreSQL but any will do)
Advanced user of cloud technology tools (Google Drive - includes Sheets Presentations Docs Appsheets etc. AWS S3 etc.)
Familiarity with task management applications (Jira Trello etc.)
Familiarity with and ability to ETL data from one platform to another
Familiarity with Python or R
Understands and can create meaningful visuals that explain workflows dataflows or system touchpoints in an intuitive way
A good candidate should
Be curious inquisitive and eager to help
Generally have  a ‚Äúyes and‚Äù mentality - everything is possible now let‚Äôs discuss logistics
Think about how data is stored and manipulated to be useful in different programs in different ways
Listen to user needs and convert those into actionable elements of work
In general  translate easily between technical and non-technical discussion and ideation
Be proactive engaged and easy to talk to and work with
Have a teaching mentality - encouraging users to learn and do more with our tools to tell a compelling story about their work has great enthusiasm for sharing information
Experience
Bachelors or Master‚Äôs degree in Geography Data Management or Library Science
2-5 years of experience working in a business environment responsible for some level of data management analysis curation and customer service
Preferentially experience or interest in mineral rights concepts
KoBold Metals is an equal opportunity workplace and an affirmative-action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity for people of any race color ancestry religion sex gender identity sexual orientation marital status national origin age citizenship marital status disability or veteran status.This position is full-time exempt.The US base salary range for this full-time exempt position is $80000 to $100000.Location: KoBold is a remote-first workplace we are open to candidates currently residing anywhere in the United States or Canada. All candidates must be authorized to legally work in either the United States or CanadaOriginally posted on Himalayas

description:

Participez √† une transformation digitale durable au c≈ìur d‚Äôune aventure humaine au sein d‚Äôun grand groupe international.Pr√™t(e) √† relever le d√©fi avec nous ?‚ÄØUn challenge s‚Äôoffre √† vous futur(e) Ing√©nieur(e) de Production DevOps !Votre r√¥le et vos missions :A l‚Äôissue de votre formation professionnalisante de 3 mois adapt√©e √† nos contextes projets vous √™tes int√©gr√©(e) au sein d‚Äôune √©quipe en tant qu‚ÄôIng√©nieur(e) de Production DevOps et avez pour mission :
Vous √™tes garant(e) du Maintien en condition op√©rationnelle (MCO) de l‚Äôinfrastructure
Vous administrez une infrastructure multiplateformes
